alert.note: Alert for Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 10:44PM CDT until May 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: .Rainfall this evening and continued runoff from snowmelt will lead to some minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following areas, Ashland, Bayfield and Sawyer. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM CDT, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chippewa Flowage East, Ashland, Washburn, Sanborn, Barksdale, Bayfield, Marengo, La Pointe, Benoit, Namekagon, Clam Lake, Namekagon Lake, Odanah, Madeline Island, Spider Lake, Mason, Grand View, Day Lake, High Bridge and Bad River Reservation. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
